text: George Gardiner Scott (11 June 1915 – 26 July 1942) was a Scottish professional football inside right who played in the Scottish League for East Fife and Aberdeen. == Personal life == Scott attended Lumphinnans Primary School. In 1941, during the Second World War, he enlisted in the RAF and during a period training in Canada, met and married his wife Jessie. Scott returned to Scotland in 1942 and was posted to No. 19 Operational Training Unit at RAF Kinloss. On 26 July 1942, Sergeant Scott, serving as an air gunner on board an Armstrong Whitworth Whitley, took off from RAF Kinloss to conduct a cross-country training exercise. The aircraft suffered engine failure in mid-air, caught fire, and crashed into the Dornoch Firth off Tain, killing all 5 on board, including Scott. The Whitley was attempting to get to RAF Tain when it crashed. His body was not recovered and he is commemorated on the Air Forces Memorial. == Career statistics == {| class="wikitable" style="text- align: center;" ! rowspan="2" |Club ! rowspan="2" |Season ! colspan="3" |League ! colspan="2" |Scottish Cup ! colspan="2" |Other ! colspan="2" |Total |- !Division !Apps !Goals !Apps !Goals !Apps !Goals !Apps !Goals |- | rowspan="5" |East Fife |1933–34 | rowspan="4" |Scottish Second Division |31 |7 |1 |0 | colspan="2" |— |32 |7 |- |1934–35 |33 |14 |0 |0 | colspan="2" |— |33 |14 |- |1935–36 |33 |14 |1 |0 | colspan="2" |— |34 |14 |- |1936–37 |27 |6 |3 |2 | colspan="2" |— |30 |8 |- ! colspan="2" |Total !124 !41 !5 !2 ! colspan="2" |— !129 !43 |- | rowspan="4" |Aberdeen |1936–37 | rowspan="3" |Scottish First Division |5 |1 | colspan="2" |— |0 |0 |5 |1 |- |1937–38 |9 |1 |0 |0 |2Appearances in Dewar Shield |0 |11 |1 |- |1938–39 |8 |0 |2 |0 |1 |0 |11 |0 |- ! colspan="2" |Total !22 !2 !2 !0 !3 !0 !27 !2 |- ! colspan="3" |Career total !146 !43 !7 !2 !3 !0 !156 !45 |} ==References== Category:1942 deaths Category:1915 births Category:British military personnel killed in World War II Category:Association football inside forwards Category:Scottish footballers Category:St Andrews United F.C. players Category:Aberdeen F.C. players Category:Lochgelly Albert F.C. players Category:Scottish Football League players Category:Royal Air Force personnel of World War II Category:East Fife F.C. players Category:People from Cowdenbeath Category:Royal Air Force airmen
